newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Serbia to establish export support fund. [CORRECTED 17:45 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Serbia to establish export support fund. [CORRECTED 17:45 GMT]

text.p: Serbia plans to set up an export support fund to help its industries increase competitiveness abroad, Industry Minister Zivota Cosic (Corrects Minister's last name from Ristic) said on Tuesday.
"The government has taken the initiative to establish a fund to help export-oriented industries and we expect the federal government to accept it," Cosic told Reuters.
The government will give its final say on the issue by June 1, Cosic said.

"I cannot talk about the size of the fund because first we need to see what sources of financing we have. But any financing will come from real sources. This is a big step forward and an offensive approach by the government," he said.

The establishment of the export support fund was a part of the government's wider strategy to kick-start its vital metal-processing complex to take part in five billion dinars ($880 million) worth of various industrial programmes.

The metal-processing industry was promised to take an active part in the China oil-for-industrial goods barter deal, revitalising the Zastava car production, some local power industry projects, telecommunications, railroads and trans-Yugoslav highways. -- Gordana Filipovic, Belgrade newsroom, +381 11 222 4254
